mods.abstract: Fish forms "swim" across the composition; their forms creating a pattern of yellow, white, magenta, blue, blu-green, and orange. A suggestion of sea waves plays across the background creating a pattern of red-orange and yellow with orange crosshatching randomly placed throughout the pattern.
mods.note: This is a cliché vérre which employed the use of three matrices, one matrix for each primary color. The artist allowed the overprinting to create secondary and terciary color forms throughout the composition. The crosshatching effect was achieved by using a "brillo pad" to scrape the emulsion of the matrices.
